name: Ensure NonANSIRightOuterJoinSyntax =* operator is not used
description: Azure SQL Database does not support the legacy =* operator, which was previously used to perform right outer joins in older versions of SQL Server. This non-ANSI syntax has been deprecated and removed. Any queries using this join style will not execute in Azure SQL Database.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: The =* operator was part of a legacy, non-ANSI join syntax that is less readable and more prone to ambiguity. Azure SQL Database enforces ANSI-standard SQL syntax, which promotes consistency, portability, and better optimization. Replacing legacy joins with ANSI-style RIGHT OUTER JOIN clauses ensures compatibility and helps modernize the database codebase.
remediation:
To resolve this issue:

Identify all queries using the =* syntax for right outer joins.

Refactor them using the ANSI RIGHT OUTER JOIN ... ON format.

Verify the updated queries return the correct results, especially where join conditions were previously implicit.
remediationSample:
-- ANSI-compliant right outer join syntax

SELECT A.EmployeeID, B.DepartmentName
FROM Employees A
RIGHT OUTER JOIN Departments B
ON A.DepartmentID = B.DepartmentID;

This ANSI-compliant form ensures proper behavior and compatibility within Azure SQL Database.
sample:
-- Using non-ANSI right outer join syntax (unsupported in Azure SQL Database)

SELECT A.EmployeeID, B.DepartmentName
FROM Employees A, Departments B
WHERE A.DepartmentID =* B.DepartmentID;

This query will fail in Azure SQL Database due to use of the =* operator.
